Čistilka za Harryja in Meghan
Kraljeva družina ponuja prosto delovno mesto. Višine plače niso razkrili.
05 Nov 2019, 21:07 by B. K. P.



GETTY IMAGESIzbrani kandidat bo skrbel tudi za goste in njihovo udobje na različnih zabavah in banketih. FOTO: GULIVER/GETTY IMAGES



Koča Frogmore, kjer bivata Meghan in Harry s sinom, stoji v Windsorju.


Britanska kraljeva družina išče pomočnico oziroma pomočnika čistilke, ki bi skrbel za red in čistočo v eni od palač Windsorjev, menda gre med drugim za kočo na posestvu Frogmore, kjer biva princ Harry z družino. Koliko je delo plačano, ne razkrivajo, bo pa izbrani kandidat lahko živel v palači v Windsorju, jedel hrano, ki jo za kraljeve pripravljajo najboljši kuharji, in na stroške kraljeve družine po potrebi tudi potoval.


Koča Frogmore, kjer bivata Meghan in Harry s sinom, stoji v Windsorju.

Od kandidatov pričakujejo izjemno natančnost in učinkovitost, naloge pa bodo vsebovale »skrb za širok nabor notranjih prostorov in reči v njih, da bodo te predstavljene v svoji najlepši luči«. V palači Windsor obljubljajo tudi, da bo delo močno obogatilo življenjepis kandidatov, saj jim poleg dobrih referenc ponujajo tudi izpopolnjevanja in »izkušnje, ki jih bodo s kandidati delili eni najboljših v svojem poslu, ki so jim le najboljši rezultati dovolj dobri«. Izbrani srečnež bo skrbel tudi za goste in njihovo udobje na različnih zabavah, piknikih in banketih. Izkušnje niso pogoj, so zapisali v oglas za prosto delovno mesto, morajo pa imeti kandidati veselje do dela in si želeti napredovati ter se izpopolnjevati.In kako najbolj uspešno do službe v kraljevi palači? »Bodite hitri, bodite popolni, bodite kratki,« potencialnim kandidatom svetuje James Upsher, ki je štiri leta delal kot pomočnik osebnega tajnika vojvode Yorškega ter zanj in njegovo družino tudi izbiral zaposlene različnih profilov. Upsher še svetuje, naj tisti, ki se prijavijo na delovno mesto, nikar ne razlagajo, da so si že kot otroci želeli delati v palači, da si želijo spoznati katerega od članov in podobno, dobro pa je, da izpostavijo svoje vezi z Veliko Britanijo in ljubezen do dežele.
Od kandidatov pričakujejo izjemno natančnost in učinkovitost, izkušnje pa niso pogoj.
»Na vsa prosta delovna mesta se prijavi ogromno ljudi, zato na razgovoru ne tratite po nepotrebnem časa tistega, ki vas intervjuva. Izpostavite svoje kompetence, odgovorite na vprašanja, a ne dolgovezite,« še dodaja Upsher.

Cleaner for Harry and Meghan
The royal family offers a vacancy. The salary levels were not disclosed.
05 Nov 2019, 21:07 by B. K. P.



GETTY IMAGESThe chosen candidate will also look after guests and their comfort at various parties and banquets. PHOTO: GULIVER / GETTY IMAGES



The Frogmore Cottage, where Meghan and Harry are staying with her son, is located in Windsor.


The British royal family is looking for a maid to help clean and tidy up one of the Windsor mansions, including a cottage on the Frogmore estate where Prince Harry and his family are staying. The amount of work paid is not disclosed, but the candidate selected will be able to live in a palace in Windsor, eat food prepared for the king by top chefs, and travel to the royal family as needed.


The Frogmore Cottage, where Meghan and Harry are staying with her son, is located in Windsor.

Candidates are expected to be extremely accurate and efficient, and the tasks will include "taking care of a wide range of interior spaces and saying that they will be presented in their most beautiful light." Windsor Palace also promises that work will greatly enrich the CVs of candidates, offering not only good references but also refinements and "experiences that will be shared with candidates by some of the best in their business who only have the best results." The chosen lucky person will also take care of the guests and their comfort at various parties, picnics and banquets. Experience is not a prerequisite, they wrote in a vacancy advertisement, but candidates must have the pleasure of working and wanting to move forward and improve themselves. "Be quick, be perfect, be short," advises potential candidates James Upsher, who worked for four years as assistant secretary-general of the Duke of York and also recruited various profiles for him and his family. Upsher further advises that those applying for a job should not be told that they wanted to work in the palace as children, that they wanted to meet a member and the like, and it is a good idea to highlight their ties with the UK and the love of the land.
Candidates are expected to be extremely accurate and efficient, but experience is not a prerequisite.
“A lot of people apply for all vacancies, so don't waste the time of the interviewer unnecessarily on the interview. Expose your competencies, answer questions, but don't owe it, "Upsher adds.
